The claim is based on a quote from Weld: both of which were conducted on September 10th.
The claim states that: 76 percent of all voters in the United States say they want Johnson-Weld, by name, in the presidential debates," but the actual poll conducted by Suffolk University only sampled 1,000 likely voters, not all voters in the United States.
The claim misrepresents the question ask: which inquired about including a third-party candidate in the debates if certified by a majority of state ballots, rather than specifically mentioning Johnson-Weld by name.
Two other polls that mentioned Johnson: Weld or Johnson alone found lower figures of support compared to the Suffolk University poll, indicating that the claim's assertion of 76 percent support may be inflated.
